The Lamplighters League is the next turn-based strategy game from the team behind Battletech and Shadowrun, but it’s also the name of the ragtag group of scoundrels you’ll be fighting with across this pulp adventure. Katharine got to see three of those characters in action during her preview - where she walked away very excited about the game’s emergent chaos - and now developer Harebrained Schemes have revealed all ten playable agents. Oh boy, do they look stylish.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Lamplighters League's agents have impeccable pulp style

articles.author: Liam Richardson
articles.description:
My wonderful co-hosts are both away this week, leaving the responsibility of writing the podcast post to the person least capable of doing so. I am but a humble video boy! My only job is to cut out the big "ums" from the audio mix, not writing words about the things we did a chat about! Thankfully this week Indiescovery is all about change, as we're experimenting with a brand new format. A group review! We've all been playing Dredge, the eldritch fishing adventure by Black Salt Games, and hoo boy do we have some thoughts about it. Spoilers: much like Katharine, we all think it's really really good.


Elsewhere, the review bonanza continues. Rachel's been rewriting fiction in Storyteller, I've been reclaiming the wasteland in Terra Nil and Rebecca has been dating hot monsters in Romancelvania. We also chat about burgers, olives and our current hyperfixations because hey, this is an episode of Indiescovery after all.

 
Read more
articles.title: Indiescovery Episode 8: The gang plays Dredge, Terra Nil, Storyteller & Romancelvania

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
Nvidia's new GeForce RTX 4070 graphics card has launched to warm reviews thanks to its performance, power efficiency and DLSS 3 - including here at RPS - but its £589 price point has been decried as a bit over the top. 
Enter Novatech, who are offering a Palit RTX 4070 for just £550, a £40 reduction from RRP and the best deal we've seen on the 4070 thus far. Add on £6 for next-day shipping and you've got a high-end card for a cool £34 off! 
Read more
articles.title: Nvidia's brand new RTX 4070 is already going for £40 off

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Desktop Dungeons: Rewind is out now. If you owned the original ten years ago, then you already own this remaster of the wonderfully sticky puzzle roguelike. If not, you'll find it on Steam for £14.23/$17.

 
Read more
articles.title: Classic puzzle roguelike remaster Desktop Dungeons: Rewind is out now

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
PowerWash Simulator has received two free pieces of DLC so far this year, both of which made use of the scrub em 'up's publisher, Square Enix, and offered up Lara Croft's manor house and Final Fantasy's Midgar for you to clean. Now a third free update has arrived, and it instead expands on PowerWash Simulator's own world.

 
Read more
articles.title: PowerWash Simulator's next free content update is out now

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The Sims 4's next two Kits represent two very different parts of the home. The Greenhouse Haven kit is all about giving you new options for how you design your garden, while the Basement Treasures kit lets you cram your subterranean hovel with "lived-in furniture and sentimental decor." Both will launch on April 20th.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Sims 4's next DLC caters to the green-fingered and the basement dwellers

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Theme park management sim Park Beyond is getting a new closed beta test, ahead of its full launch on June 16th. It’s a whacky-looking game that lets you build impossible rollercoaster rides that are just begging to be sued, all while you try to turn a profit running your park. The closed beta is completely free and begins on May 9th, so if you want a test ride, you can register at this link. In the meantime, publisher Bandai Namco have also released a new, more in-depth gameplay trailer, giving us a closer look at some of the minutiae involved in running a theme park.

 
Read more
articles.title: Impossible theme park manager Park Beyond gets a closed beta test next month

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
In the world of turn-based strategy games, it's probably fair to say that we've been waiting a heck of a long time for Jagged Alliance to make its next move. Almost a quarter of a century has passed since the last numbered entry in the series, and the many attempts that have been made to recapture its tactical, mercenary magic since then have been mixed at best, and reviled at worst. Haemimont Games, the devs behind Tropico and current custodians of the upcoming Jagged Alliance 3, know this, and their publisher THQ Nordic said as much back in September 2021 when it was first revealed, assuring players they were going to create a game that "really does justice to the Jagged Alliance legacy".  
But in an era where turn-based tactics games are now increasingly defined by genre titans such as XCOM and Into The Breach, I'm not sure that legacy means all that much anymore. I've been playing a substantial early chunk of Jagged Alliance 3 over the last week or so, and its decision to pare back crucial information such as chance-to-hit and other modern conveniences has mostly left me feeling frustrated and annoyed rather than daring and excited. The writing also made me cringe so hard at times I think even the neighbours heard my groans of despair. It certainly looks the part of a modern strategy game, its detailed African landscape, top down perspective and interactive objects calling to mind Mimimi's excellent Desperados 3 and Shadow Tactics games, but the rest feels like it's been lifted straight out of the late 90s where we last left Jagged Alliance 2 - and not necessarily to its benefit.
Read more
articles.title: Jagged Alliance 3 desperately wants it to be 1999 again, and not in a good way

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Game Pass people likely have their mouths full with this month’s earlier offerings, which included the never-ending Loop Hero and the meaty Goat Simulator. But Microsoft have already announced the next wave of Game Pass additions for April, and there are some even tastier treats on the table. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Minecraft Legends joins Game Pass today, while Tetris Effect Connected is leaving

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Ray tracing is coming back to the Resident Evil 2 and Resident Evil 3 remakes on PC, according to Capcom. That’s after the graphical option was quietly removed from both games this past week, following a recent update. Fans had been wondering if the move was deliberate or not, but Capcom’s announcement seems to confirm that it was just a mishap. So, zombie slayers should be able to go back to running around in realistically lit corridors full of shadowy corners very soon.

 
Read more
articles.title: Ray tracing is coming back to the Resident Evil 2 and Resident Evil 3 remakes

articles.author: Rick Lane
articles.description:
To pre-empt your first question, no, Dead Island 2 was not worth waiting eleven years for. In its defence, however, few things are. If George Romero had taken over a decade to make Night Of The Living Dead, the fact it takes place largely in a basement would look less like canny guerrilla filmmaking and more like staggering incompetence. It only took NASA eight years to put men on the moon from the point they started trying, which puts the value of many inhibited projects (like my folder of unfinished novels) into depressingly sharp relief.


Dead Island 2 does not put zombies on the moon, though given how daft the main game is, don't rule out a Dead Island 2: Moon's Haunted expansion shambling your way in late 2023. Yet that doesn't mean it's a bad game. In fact, it's quite an enjoyable one. Together, Deep Silver and Dambuster Studios have raised a moderately entertaining sequel to Techland's ye olde zombie survival sim, one that injects some life into its desiccated subject matter by being incredibly shiny, wilfully silly, spectacularly gory, and generally a touch more imaginative than I expected.

 
Read more
articles.title: Dead Island 2 review: as disposably entertaining as an electrified pipe-wrench

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Pentiment director and long-time Obsidian developer Josh Sawyer has shed some light on the Aliens RPG that was in production at the studio and sadly cancelled by publisher Sega. Looking back at cancelled games is always a fun "what if" exercise, especially in this case. Obsidian’s role-playing chops in an Aliens game? Were our charisma stats going to protect us from the ever-murderous Xenomorphs? 

 
Read more
articles.title: Obsidian's Aliens RPG was canned because of dysfunction and slow progress, Josh Sawyer reveals

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Hello folks. I come bearing a reasonably sensitive question for you today, and that's how the current cost of living crisis has affected your day to day gaming habits. We know times are tough for a lot of people right now, but if you can spare five minutes to tell us about it in a new reader survey put together for us by our corporate uncle Reedpop, we'd be very grateful. 
Read more
articles.title: How has the cost of living crisis affected the way you play and buy games these days?

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
As one of the very best survival games on PC (according to us and RPS readers), Valheim is getting even more ways to play around in its Norse sandbox. Developer Jonathan Smårs took to Twitter yesterday to tease a bunch of difficulty presets and customisable sliders, letting you modify the Viking experience to your liking. The options include both a creative mode (a là Minecraft) and a more 'immersive' option.

 
Read more
articles.title: Valheim details customisable difficulty settings and a sort-of creative mode

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Valve and CodeWeavers have released the latest version of Proton, their compatibility software that allows Windows games to run on Linux-based operating systems – like that of the Steam Deck. Proton 8.0 is a biggun, smoothing out compatibility issues for over a dozen games (including the Dead Space remake and Forspoken) while making Steam Deck-specific fixes to many more.
These include an update that should make the repeatedly troublesome 2K Launcher behave itself again, while Tiny Tina’s Wonderlands gets improved sleep/resume functionality on the handheld PC. A crashing issue with Life is Strange Remastered Collection has also been nixxed, as has a bug that for some reason forced open the Deck’s onscreen keyboard when launching A Plague Tale: Innocence and A Plague Tale: Requiem. Most of the other addressed problems don’t look as funny in my head, but you can read them all in the full patch notes regardless.
Downloading Proton 8.0 onto the Steam Deck is easy enough: just search for it in your Library, tap or select the icon when it appears in the results, hit Install, and restart when it’s done. Begone, foul keyboards.
 Read more
articles.title: Proton 8.0 is here, and it brought Steam Deck game fixes

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
The first-person puzzler Firmament is releasing on May 18th, developers Cyan have announced. The studio behind the influential Myst first teased the game back in 2018, before turning to Kickstarter a year later to fund their steampunk mystery, and now it’s ready for release, playable in both VR and “2D” - or flatscreen displays. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Myst studio Cyan are releasing their next first-person puzzler Firmament in May

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
The Ryzen 7 5800X3D remains one of the fastest gaming CPUs on the market, and the release of Ryzen 7000 X3D CPUs has pushed prices down even further on the best option for existing AM4 motherboards and DDR4 RAM. 
The 5800X3D is currently cheapest at Amazon, where you can get the processor for £281. That's the cheapest we've ever seen this highly-respected model. 
Read more
articles.title: The AMD Ryzen 7 5800X3D remains one of the fastest gaming CPUs - and now it's down to £281

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
Last week we posted a deal on a fast 512GB Micro SD card, and now we're back with another UK deal on an even faster and even larger model ideal for high-performance applications, from loading up a Steam Deck or Switch with a huge amount of game storage or capturing 4K footage on a DLSR, action camera or drone.
The SanDisk Extreme Pro 1TB is as good as it gets when it comes to Micro SD cards, with up to 200MB/s reads and 140MB/s writes, and it's down to £140 on Amazon today compared to £172 for the same card earlier this month. 
Read more
articles.title: Pick up this SanDisk Extreme Pro 1TB Micro SD card for a historic low price

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
The Samsung 870 Qvo is one of the best large-capacity SATA SSDs, offering up to 8TB of storage in a classic 2.5-inch form factor. It normally retails for around £452, but now it's 10% off, bringing it to the lowest price we've seen on Amazon UK: £408. That's a great price for a tonne of game and media storage. 
Read more
articles.title: 8TB enough storage for you? This Samsung 870 Qvo SATA SSD is down to £408

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
We recently covered the RX 6950 XT hitting a new low price point in the US in the wake of the RTX 4070's release - and thankfully UK buyers have an even better deal available. 
The ultra-fancy Sapphire Nitro+ OC model of the RX 6950 XT is now selling for £630, making it just £30 more expensive than Nvidia's latest graphics cards - a great deal if you look at specs like rasterised performance (where 6950 XT is around 20% faster) and VRAM allocation (where 6950 XT has 16GB compared to 12GB on the 4070).  
Read more
articles.title: Save £420 on the RX 6950 XT 16GB - in its premier Sapphire Nitro+ OC configuration

articles.author: Diana Croce
articles.description:
1979’s Akalabeth: World Of Doom, eventually renamed Ultima 0, is the first commercial game by Richard Garriott (himself aka'd Lord British), and one of the very first roleplaying video games to enter the market. It’s also a precursor to Garriott’s Ultima series, introducing many elements that formed the core of the following games. But everything that Akalabeth invented would eventually be abandoned, first by its sequels and then the entire RPG genre.

 
Read more
articles.title: The first CRPG is a min-maxing hell you can - and should - break

articles.author: Rachel Watts
articles.description:
I honestly thought I was good at detective games until I started playing the early access build for Shadows of Doubt. I mean, I’ve riddled through The Case Of The Golden Idol’s intuitive fill-the-blanks whodunnits, wrestled with Return Of The Obra Dinn’s sixty missing persons, grappled with the mysteries of the very gods themselves in Paradise Killer, and don’t get me started on Danganronpa’s ridiculous mind-bending, patience-testing murder mysteries.
That being said, ColePowered Games' detective immersive sim has really left me stumped, forcing me to hang my deer stalker on a hat peg in shame and sling my detective's notebook out a window. Shadows Of Doubt is like no other detective game I've played, and although its murder mysteries have left me spiraling, I've had an absolute riot playing it.
Read more
articles.title: The procedurally generated serial killer in Shadows Of Doubt is too smart for me

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
When I think of quintessentially British games, a few highlights come to mind. Fable's fairytale world of stocky goblins and poverty-stricken orphans with Victorian-era voices is definitely very British, as is Banjo-Kazooie’s dry wit and sarcasm. A decent bucket of contenders, but the crown has to go to the Greggs Simulator, a free shop sim that tasks you with managing a Greggs pasty shop that's a staple of every UK high street. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Run Britain's famous pasty shop in the new and improved free Greggs Simulator

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Wonky launch woes aside, The Last Of Us Part 1’s PC release is a net positive. A new audience can now experience one of PlayStation’s best exclusives, but even better, modders can get their hands on Joel and Ellie’s trek, rejigging a familiar story in new ways. There aren’t too many exciting ones available to download just yet, but one “in-progress” mod reimagines the game in first-person, and it’s stunning.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Last Of Us Part 1's "in-progress" mod reimagines the game as a beautiful FPS

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
When The Witcher Remake devs Fool's Theory and 11 bit studios announced their new RPG The Thaumaturge at the very end of February, I'll admit that the premise didn't immediately grab me. The announcement trailer was little more than an enigmatic pan through the streets of historic Warsaw, and its climactic reveal of a shadowy man performing some Naruto finger magic to conjure a Soulsian monster from the gloom made it seem like yet another supernatural yarn in the vein of Frogwares' The Sinking City and Cyanide's Call Of Cthulhu. The gameplay trailer (embedded below) that followed a few days later revealed a teeny glimmer of what its monster fights actually look like in the flesh, but I still wasn't quite convinced this supernatural tale of demon tamers and interdimensional rifts would end up doing enough to make it stand out. 
But actually clapping eyes on it in person at GDC? The Thaumaturge had my full attention. Set in Warsaw in 1905 - a period where Poland didn't exist on any real-life map due to it being under occupation by Russia, Germany and Austria at the time - this dark fantasy RPG sees its titular paranormal 'miracle worker' delve deep into the city's political tensions, conducting isometric detective investigations that pull from Fool's Theory's support work on Larian's Divinity: Original Sin games, while also engaging in striking turn-based battles to root out the corruption plaguing its citizens. Plus, with its hard lean into Slavic, rather than Lovecraftian, folklore for its ungodly ghoulies, The Thaumaturge has shot right to the top of my 'keep an eye on this maybe surprise hit' list. 
Read more
articles.title: The Thaumaturge is a detective RPG that's part Divinity: Original Sin, part evil Pokémon

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Fans have likely spent endless seasons in the comfort of Stardew Valley, and now the chill life sim is getting even bigger. Stardew Valley’s creator Eric Barone (otherwise known as ConcernedApe) is “taking a break” from working on his highly-anticipated Haunted Chocolatier. Barone will instead work on Stardew Valley’s upcoming 1.6 update, which focuses on improvements for modders, alongside some new content as well. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Concerned Ape is taking a break from Haunted Chocolatier to work on Stardew Valley’s next update

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
For hardware that’s all about searing speed, advances in SSD tech can be a Beckettian waiting game. Microsoft’s DirectStorage has only so far only found support in the ho-hum Forspoken, and PCIe 5.0 SSDs still aren’t widely available despite the first compatible CPUs and motherboards launching in 2021.
However, the latter are coming soon, and I’ve been testing out an engineering sample of the Crucial T700 to see how PCIe 5.0 – also known as PCIe Gen5 – drives could perform in an honest-to-goodness gaming PC. The short version: with maximum read and write speeds that tower over the current generation’s best SSDs, albeit with less impact on game load times than such explosive pace would suggest.
Read more
articles.title: The Crucial T700 shows the promise, and limits, of PCIe 5.0 SSDs

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Publisher Nexon have filed a lawsuit against Ironmace Games, the developers behind the multiplayer looter Dark And Darker, accusing the studio and two individual developers of copyright infringement. The two Korean companies recently went public with their dispute, but now their beef has extended to the US legal system where Nexon is demanding a trial by jury.

 
Read more
articles.title: Nexon are suing Dark And Darker developers over copyright infringement

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Sundays are for spending your first weekend back in the UK in a while, and feeling a bit disoriented. Before you settle back in, let's read this week's best writing about games (and game related things).
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Shardpunk: Verminfall smooshes together a bunch of different ideas you'll have seen before. It's got turn-based tactical combat against rats with magic rifles in a steampunk world already in ruins. It's got the need to keep on moving, lest an approaching rat horde overwhelm you. It's got bunkers in which your party rests, de-stresses, and tools up before moving on.

Kind of a Fallouty, XCOMy, FTLy, Vermintidey mix, then - which together seems very cool. It's out now, and there's a demo.

 
Read more
articles.title: Shardpunk: Verminfall is a mashup of Darkest Dungeon, XCOM and Skaven

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Occasionally I wonder if the market for wholesome town builders has reached saturation, but then a trailer pops up for another one and I'm never less than intrigued. The latest is Fabledom, which promises the pastoral fields and castle wall construction I adore, then adds a twist by being set within a fairytale kingdom. It's in early access now.

 
Read more
articles.title: Fabledom is a fairytale citybuilder about romancing princes and princesses

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Mordhau is about alternately bashing at other players with swords, axes and polearms, and teaming up with other players for playful buffoonery with lutes, emotes, and spontaneous roleplay. It was one of our favourite games of 2019 and it's currently free to keep from the Epic Games Store.

 
Read more
articles.title: Mordhau is currently free to keep from the Epic Games Store

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Part of the fun of Vampire Survirors lies in discovering new weapons and items, and knowing that there are still surprises to uncover as you construct your monster murder machine. That thrill fades as complete more runs and reach the game's edges, but its DLCs are so far doing a good job of creating new, uncharted territory. The latest, Tides Of The Foscari, is out now.

 
Read more
articles.title: Vampire Survivors' Tides Of The Foscari DLC is out

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
If you're starting playing Ghostwire: Tokyo after it came to Game Pass this week, I have a hot tip for you: prioritise upgrading movement abilities. The freedom to glide from rooftop to rooftop over haunted Tokyo will bring you so much more joy than any incremental damage upgrade. That's the most important thing I have to say, that it makes for good virtuatourism.
Oh, and I suppose a free content arrived this week too, adding new side-missions, handy new combat abilities, and a new "rogue-lite" mode. The update, uh, apparently also added Denuvo, over a year after the game launched? Cool, cool.
Read more
articles.title: Ghostwire: Tokyo has added new stuff, and I have a tourism tip for new players

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
This week, for the first time in a long time, I stayed up way past my bedtime playing a video game. I had left weird abiogenesis idle clicker The Barnacle Goose Experiment running in the background for a few days, dithering a bit any time I stumbled back across the browser tab, until one day it hit me. I don't remember what it was, but one discovery was so strange and exciting that I then sat there for four hours, thinking "I'll go to bed when this result comes in", and then. Woof. I am now far too old to stay up past my bedtime playing video games, and am still tired. Anyway! What are you playing this weekend? Here's what we're clicking on!
Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
I'd planned on starting with a line about how Loretta is an exception to how psychological horror games are about trudging around an abandoned mental hospital with the worst torch in the world until the girl from Ringu menaces you. It was already interesting and good enough pretty much right away to earn a recommendation, but after one of what will definitely be several playthroughs, leaving my praise that faint would do it a terrible injustice.


Loretta is goddamn excellent by any standard. Where other games use the mentally unwell narrator to explain everything away with "turns out you're secretly crazy", it's instead just one layer of a complex horror mystery with splashes of drama and noir, whose surprises I'm straining not to spoil.

 
Read more
articles.title: Look, just bloody play Loretta, damn you

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
I'm always up for trying new and odd foods. I mean, I barbecued some womb in a restaurant in Japan recently, and I can confirm that it was like calamari but tougher, and, largely, a lot worse. So, that's why the idea of Pringles releasing a limited-edition Minecraft Suspicious Stew flavour intrigues me! I would like to give it a go and see if it's actually quite nice or makes me barf.
Read more
articles.title: Minecraft Pringles are a thing, and I'd quite like some

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Japan's brutal working culture isn't exactly a secret. You've probably heard the horror stories, or at least, got the general gist that success in Japanese business often equates to time. You don't necessarily need to be doing work, you just need to be present as the clock hands shift. A hard worker is reduced to a statue that only springs to life again when their boss gets up to leave.
Mr. Saitou is a short pixel art RPG that offers a hilarious commentary on the absurdities of working culture in Japan, with occasional flashes of seriousness. Completable in one sitting, it's a game I'd recommend to anyone.
Read more
articles.title: Mr. Saitou is a heartfelt commentary on the absurdities of business

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
I spent my morning trying and failing to rise from the depths of a vast Brutalist tower in Beton Brutal, a new first-person platformer. It's a challenging climb yet a curiously chill vibe, perhaps because any time I fall all the way down, I'm delighted to be back surrounded by overgrown plants and sculptures rising from a pond. The developer says Beton Brutal "tries to replicate and build upon the parkour mechanics seen in Minecraft," and I think I have a lot to learn. I didn't even know Minecraft had parkour.
Read more
articles.title: Climb a Brutalist tower in this first-person platformer inspired by Minecraft parkour

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
Update: this post originally said Gloomrot is coming "next week" because I don't know what month it is.
Frakenstein is often cited as the first science fiction thing, and now it can add to its honours because it's the inspiration for the first major update to V Rising. The info on Secrets Of Gloomrot doesn't actually use the F word anywhere, but it's a new biome "twisted by the tortured ambitions of a scientific genius and his legions of followers", so I feel pretty confident in the citation. This new free addition to the early access vampiric survival game - which won a few hearts here at RPS - is arriving on May 17th. That's in a month, that is, and boy, it's a biggun alright. 
Read more
articles.title: V Rising's big free update adds an electrified Frankenstein land

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
If you recognise the name PlayWay it is because PlayWay publishes most of the [Noun] Simulator games, often but not always involving being a mechanic of some kind. Today, though, I'm excited to tell you that with their next game, developed by PlayWay subsidiary Games Incubator, they're branching out into the long-neglected magical horsegirl genre with My Horse: Bonded Spirits.
Read more
articles.title: PlayWay's latest sim game appears to be Barbie Horse Adventures

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
The Logitech G305 Lightspeed, a top-tier wireless gaming mouse that normally retails for £60, has dropped to £30 at Amazon UK this morning. Here's why we rate it.
In short, the G305 offers a lightweight design, fast and reliable Lightspeed wireless, 300 hours of battery life and a comfortable shape, making it ideal for a wide range of use case for competitive gaming on a desktop PC to a light, comfy mouse for working on a laptop in a cafe. 
Read more
articles.title: The Logitech G305 Lightspeed wireless gaming mouse is down to £30

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si přečteme v rychlosti texty, podíváme se na čtečku pro Wikipedii, přečteme si elektronické knihy a porovnáme mezi sebou obrázky a videa.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (26. 4. 2023): přizpůsobivá čtečka elektronických knih

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Lukáš Malý)
articles.description: Po roce používáni satelitního internetu Starlink jsem dospěl k výměne routeru výrobce za jiný kvůli IPv6 a dalším funkcionalitám a začalo mě zajímat, jaký je dlouhodobý stav služby. Začal jsem ji monitorovat.
articles.title: Rok zkušeností se Starlinkem: stabilní a rychlý internet na samotě

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Vývojáři se setkávají s číselnými hodnotami, které nelze reprezentovat základními datovými typy (int, float, atd.). Z tohoto důvodu se v mnoha jazycích setkáme s podporou hodnot s neomezeným rozsahem či volitelnou přesností.
articles.title: Číselné hodnoty s neomezeným rozsahem a přesností v programovacím jazyku Go (1)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Kopřiva)
articles.description: V dnešním díle pravidelného pondělního souhrnu se podíváme na změny v šíření malwaru QBot, ransomware LockBit cílící na macOS nebo havárii vrtulníku údajně způsobenou chybějící softwarovou záplatou.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: bez záplat v software už nelétají ani vrtulníky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Vyšlo nové Ubuntu 23.04 s kódovým označením „Lunar Lobster“. Projekt Solus plánuje návrat po měsících nečinnosti. Vyšla Fedora 38 s plným přístupem k Flathubu. Firmware Libreboot přidává podporu pro starší notebooky.
articles.title: Linuxová distribuce Solus se vrací, vyšlo Ubuntu 23.04 s GNOME 44

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Uběhlo 20 let od uvedení prvních 64bitových procesorů x86–64, aktualizace ovladače Intel Arc pro Ubuntu 22.04 LTS, týden v KDE hlavně ve znamení oprav chyb, vydáno QEMU 8.0.0.
articles.title: 20 let od prvních 64bitových Opteronů, dokončen přechod GIMPu na GTK3

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Ubuntu 23.04 a všechny jeho varianty přinášejí řadu novinek a vylepšení. Dočkali jsme se nového instalátoru, aktualizace velké spousty aplikací a také nového linuxového jádra či prostředí GNOME 44.
articles.title: Ubuntu 23.04 Lunar Lobster přichází s GNOME 44 a novým instalátorem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Koňařík)
articles.description: S pojmem Device Authorization Grant, nebo také Device Code Flow (dále již DCF) se ne úplně každý setkal, nicméně s jeho použitím téměř jistě ano. Stačí, že jste někdy zprovozňovali televizi nebo chytré hodinky.
articles.title: Device Authorization Grant: přihlášení bez rozumného uživatelského vstupu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Dnešní článek o vývoji programů pro mikropočítač ZX Spectrum je rozdělen na dvě části. V úvodní části si ukážeme využití instrukce DAA při tisku hexadecimálních hodnot a v části druhé se seznámíme se základy zpracování hodnot s plovoucí řádovou čárkou.
articles.title: Tisk hexadecimálních hodnot s využitím instrukce DAA na ZX Spectru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Dnes si představíme editor pro psaní románů, budeme převádět mezi formáty digitálních souborů a vyzkoušíme si přehrávač vizuálních efektů, animací a počítačové grafiky.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (19. 4. 2023): textový editor pro psaní románů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Možnost využívat vnoření dílčích časových os do celého projektu je hlavní novinkou Kdenlive23.04, novinkou připravovanou poslední čtyři roky od tehdejšího refactoringu kódu projektu.
articles.title: Kdenlive 23.04 přináší vnořené časové osy i OpenAI Whisper

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Zatímco jiné megakorporace propouští tisíce a tisíce vývojářů, současná vlna propouštění v IT dosáhla i k Red Hatu, ale v podstatně menší míře. Různé zdroje v Severní Karolíně hlásí, že firma oznámila rušení stovek pracovních pozic.
articles.title: Red Hat propustí stovky zaměstnanců

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Několik novinek měli tvůrci zvukového editoru Audacity tu drzost přidat do verze 3.3.0. Potěší možnost používat některé efekty jako realtime (Bass & Treble, Distortion, Phaser, Reverb a Wahwah). Přibyl dále nový efekt Shelf Filter a počáteční beta verze prvků Beats a Measures..
articles.title: Audacity 3.3.0 s realtime efekty a řadou zkušebních novinek

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Miro)
articles.description: Už zítra 26. dubna 2023 od 10:00 se uskuteční webinář věnovaný instalaci a konfiguraci open-source bezpečnostní platformy Wazuh.
articles.title: Online webinář: Wazuh, instalace a konfigurace

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V Brně o víkendu proběhl Linux Apps Summit a k této příležitosti změnil obchod Flathub.org s aplikacemi ve formátu Flatpak svůj vzhled.
articles.title: Flathub.org má nový vzhled

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Tým projektu BIRD vydal minulý týden dvě nové verze svého routovacího démona. V pátek vyšla experimentální vícevláknová verze označená jako 3.0-alpha1. Oproti stabilní verzi 2 očekávají vývojáři u této verze tří až osminásobné zrychlení (zejména při zátěži protokoly BGP a RPKI).
articles.title: CZ.NIC vydal dvě nové verze routovacího démona BIRD

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Provozujete vlastní infrastrukturu a chcete vědět, v jakém stavu se v každém okamžiku nachází? Zabbix vám umožní monitorovat infrastrukturu z pohledu sítí, tak i z pohledu operačních systémů až po aplikace. Přináší ucelené monitorovací řešení. Naučíme vás konfigurovat monitorovací systém Zabbix od základních kroků až po složité nízkoúrovňové objevování monitorovaných objektů.
articles.title: Zabbix: monitorujte svou infrastrukturu a mějte ji pod kontrolou (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Zdenek Henek)
articles.description: Čtrnáctý ročník ne-konference jOpenSpace se koná 6. – 8. října 2023 v Hotelu Antoň v Telči. Pro účast je potřeba vyplnit registrační formulář. Ne-konference neznamená, že se organizátorům nechce připravovat program, ale naopak dává prostor všem pozvaným, aby si program sami složili z toho nejzajímavějšího, čím se v poslední době zabývají nebo co je oslovilo.
articles.title: Registrace na jOpenSpace 2023 jsou otevřeny

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Souborový systém Btrfs má parametr discard_async již od jádra 5.6. V jádře 6.2 pak je tato volba zapnuta ve výchozím stavu. Jde o pomalé trimování nepoužívaných bloků v době, kdy se s diskem zrovna nepracuje.
articles.title: Vylepšený Btrfs discard_async v jádře 6.3

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Podle očekávání vyšlo linuxové jádro verze 6.3, podstatným novinkám jsme se už věnovali v samostatném článku. Toto vydání odstraňuje podporu mnoha souborů a ovladačů týkajících se zastaralých desek s procesory Arm, dále vylepšuje stále minimalistickou podporu jazyka Rust, rozšiřuje možnosti BPF, přidává ID-mapped mounts pro souborový systém tmpfs, nabízí podporu BIG TCP pro IPv4 a podporu nespustitelných memfds.
articles.title: Jádro 6.3 odstraňuje podporu starých desek a grafických karet

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Člověk by si myslel, že jej souborový systém EXT4 už nemůže nijak překvapit. Ale stalo se mi, že nabootuji SystemRescue, vytvořím na něm nový EXT4, tam pomocí tar c | tar x přenesu starý OS. Opravím /etc/fstab, opravím Grub a systém stejně nenastartuje. Zasekne se při kontrole rootfs a říká záhadnou chybu:
articles.title: Záludnosti EXT4

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Alokátor paměti SLOB byl v jádře 6.2 označen jako zastaralý. Protože si nikdo nestěžoval, správce alokátorů Vlastimil Babka ze SUSE navrhl jeho odstranění z jádra 6.4.
articles.title: SLOB bude odstraněn z jádra 6.4

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Pokud máte gigabitovou síťovou kartu Intel i219-LM a jádro novější než 5.8, tak vám jede jen na asi 60 % při rychlostech 100 a 10 Mb/s. Karta i219-LM používá jako i jiné Intel gigabitové síťovky ovladač e1000e. Oprava spočívá ve vypnutí TSO (TCP Segment Offload), které způsobuje přetečení vyrovnávací paměti.
articles.title: Síťová karta Intel i219-LM jede jen na 60 %, oprava bude v jádře 6.3

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Automatizace pomocí continuous integration přímo v Gitlabu. CI vám pomůže automatizovat rutinní procesy a ušetří vám hromadu času. Pomůže vám od automatického testování, buildy po nasazování. Chcete vědět víc? Přijďte na naše školení GitLab CI, které se uskuteční 9. května. Proběhne v Praze a můžete se ho zúčastnit také online. Školí Ondřej Sika.
articles.title: Gitlab CI: automatizujte přímo v Gitlabu (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Knihovna libuv je multiplatformní knihovna pro podporu asynchronního I/O. Nově od verze  1.45.0 bude používat na Linuxu IO_uring pro některé asynchronní operace: read, write, fsync, fdatasync, stat, fstat a  lstat.
articles.title: Knihovna libuv 1.45 bude na Linuxu používat IO_uring

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na Steamu je možné zdarma získat hru Desktop Dungeons Enhanced Edition. Jde o hru na jeskyně a draky (D&D) s jednoduchými pravidly a malým vlivem náhody. Jeskyně jsou náhodně generovány a můžete v nich umřít do 10 minut na mnoho způsobů.
articles.title: Hra zdarma na Steamu: Desktop Dungeons

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Malých písíček s označením Elite 8200 od Hewlett-Packard byly ještě nedávno plné obchody s repasovanými PC. Kdo tehdy zakoupil, může dnes na takový stroj nasadit otevřený BIOS z projektu Libreboot, neb ten nyní pro tyto stroje přidal podporu.
articles.title: Libreboot podporuje stařičké stroje HP Elite 8200 SFF

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Godot 4.0 je od března zdárně venku a tvůrci tohoto herního enginu se nyní dělí o své plány na verzi 4.1. Kromě toho, že se budou dále ladit novinky čtyřkové řady, dojde i na další zlepšení.
articles.title: Plány pro Godot 4.1: TAA, FSR 2.2 i rychlejší běh Vulkanu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost PC Engines, která stojí za populárními deskami APU a před nimi WRAP a ALIX, oznámila ukončení jejich výroby. Hlavním důvodem je, že AMD přestane prodávat vhodné procesory série Embedded G. Poslední objednávky budou vyřízeny v červnu letošního roku a pak bude s touto řadou procesorů konec.
articles.title: PC Engines končí s výrobou desek APU, přestane dostávat vhodné procesory od AMD

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Závislost na západních GPU se Čína před pár lety rozhodla vyřešit založením místní společnosti Moore Threads. Letos byla ohlášena první GPU pod touto značkou a vývojáři z Moore Threads již (vedle samozřejmě podpory platformy Windows) přispívají kousky kódu do relevantních open-source projektů.
articles.title: Moore Threads, čínský výrobce GPU, již přispívá do FFmpeg a VA-API

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)

articles.author: Zdenek H.
articles.description: Čtrnáctý ročník ne-konference jOpenSpace se koná 6. – 8. října 2023 v Hotelu Antoň v Telči. Pro účast je potřeba vyplnit registrační formulář. Ne-konference neznamená, že se organizátorům nechce připravovat program, ale naopak dává prostor všem pozvaným, aby si program sami složili z toho nejzajímavějšího, čím se v poslední době zabývají nebo co je oslovilo. Obsah, který vytváří všichni účastníci, se skládá z desetiminutových prezentací a delších workshopů s převážně vývojářskou tematikou od devops, přes datové struktury, nástroje, jazyky, zkušenosti s automatizací testů a různé zajímavosti ze světa IT. Co je potřeba udělat, abyste se mohli zúčastnit? Připravit si desetiminutovou prezentaci na libovolné téma, která má potenciál oslovit ostatní přítomné. Historicky proběhlo i několik velmi zajímavých nevývojářských témat, takže ani výletu do úplně jiného oboru není třeba se nikterak bránit.

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Jaký bude vliv Aktu o kybernetické odolnosti (Cyber Resilience Act) nebo Směrnice o odpovědnosti za vadné výrobky (Product Liability Directive) na svobodný a open source software? Nejenom právníci Python Software Foundation, FSFE nebo ISC a NLnet Labs mají s návrhy nové evropské legislativy problém. Vývojář svobodného a open source softwaru přece nemůže být zodpovědný za chybu ve svém kódu, která se projevila v pro něm neznámém komerčním řešení a způsobila někomu problémy nebo ztráty. Návrhům nové legislativy se věnoval také Marcel Kolaja ve své přednášce na LAS 2023.
articles.title: Jaký bude vliv Aktu o kybernetické odolnosti (Cyber Resilience Act) nebo Směrnice o odpovědnosti za vadné výrobky (Product Liability Directive) na svobodný a open source software?

Henry Cavill's last Witcher outing will be split into two parts
Netflix's The Witcher is heading into Season 3. Today, we got dates for both of its premieres across volumes one and two, as well as a look at Henry Cavill's last season as Geralt of Rivia.
The new teaser trailer confirms that Volume One of Season 3 premieres on June 29, containing episodes 1 through 5. Then, on July 27, Volume 2 will go live with episodes 6 through 8.
In today's teaser, we see Cavill's Geralt down a concoction and seemingly prepare for combat. We also see Yennefer (Anya Chalotra) and Ciri (Freya Allen), too.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EUlC8ue8NFI
Season 3 will mark the last season for Henry Cavill as Geralt of Rivia, before the mantle passes to Liam Hemsworth starting in Season 4. While there isn't much …
articles.title: Netflix’s The Witcher gets new teaser and premiere dates for Season 3

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Their name was Pizza!?
Purveyor of video game merch, Fangamer, has released a plush of the protagonist of 2021’s Chicory: A Colorful Tale. And, oh my gosh, just look at it.
Designed by Alexis Dean-Jones and Audrey Waner, this Pizza plush is 8” tall. It comes with a magnetic paintbrush that attaches to their hand and includes a set of washable markers so you can draw on them. It's a rather cute nod to the game, where you could draw on anything in the game world, and even paint your character to customize them.
Chicory: A Colorful Tale was Destructoid’s 2021 Game of the Year. I personally handled the review of it, and if I’m not mistaken, it still is my highest scored game at a 9.5. I really connected with the themes of depression, anxiety, and imposter syndrome. It hit hard during one of the most difficult times of my life, and helped me gain confidence when I was just starting to get my feet on the ground at Destructoid.
I completely forgot the protagonist has the default name of Pizza. It asks you to enter your favorite food at the start of the game, so I named my hero Tacos. I at least remembered they weren’t named Chicory, because that’s the name of the burnt-out bunny who helps you along. I really relate to that bunny.
Damn, that was a good game.
The Pizza plush from Chicory: A Colorful Tale is available now at Fangamer for $32 USD.
The post Fangamer has an adorable Chicory plush that you can draw on appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Fangamer has an adorable Chicory plush that you can draw on

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Git Reddy Fur...
While we don't have an exact release date for Bandai Namco's flashy-looking scrapper Tekken 8, (with the good money pointing to spring 2024), that hasn't stopped the publisher from throwing the levers on the hype engine, having already released over 10 dynamic character trailers, spotlighting the heroes and villains who are getting in gear for the next King of Iron Fist Tournament.
Since its inception way back in 1994, the Tekken universe has grown at an alarming rate, with somewhere in the region of 90 characters — should you choose to include all Jacks, all descendants, and guest stars. As such, there is quite the roster to choose from when putting together each new sequel, and while Tekken 8 is already filling up the ranks with fan favorites such as Ling Xiayou, Asuka Kazama, Lili Rochefort, King, and Leroy Smith, there are still many familiar faces, old and new, unaccounted for.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p07h8qIsUd4
My main squeeze, Lili, has already made the cut, and she's frankly the only Tekken character I have any real degree of competency with. But that doesn't mean I wouldn't also like to see characters such as Master Raven, Lidia Sobieska, and Anna Williams (imagine those fashions in Unreal 5) join the party. And, of course, there's always room for one of the franchise's finest creations, The Absolute Menace, Lucky Chloe.
But let's hear from you in our beloved community, who are you eagerly hoping will step back into the ring, the lab, and the bowling alley this time around? Are you waiting on a classic such as Julia Chang or Lei WuLong, an oddity such as Mokujin or Dr. Boskonovitch, or even one of the latter-day stars such as Katarina Alves or Fahkumram? Whoever you wanna see, tell us all about it!
Tekken 8 is currently in development for PS5, PC, and Xbox Series X. It is tentatively expected to launch late in 2023 or early 2024.
The post Which characters do you want to see make the cut for Tekken 8? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Which characters do you want to see make the cut for Tekken 8?

articles.author: Matt Cook
articles.description:
The Steam Deck competitor's price tag will be 'below $1,000'
Asus has is hosting a launch event for its handheld PC gaming device, the ROG Ally, on May 11. The announcement comes just over a week after Asus said the Ally release may be "sooner than you expect." Given that the device was only announced on April 1, May 11 certainly fits the bill of "sooner than we expected."
Asus is keeping most of the ROG Ally's details close to the chest for now. On May 11, the company is hosting a launch event to reveal the full system specs, price, and availability. A spokesperson told PC Gamer that the price "will be below $1,000. 200% it will be below $1,000." PC Gamer's preview also says the launch date is the same as the stream: May 11.
https://twitter.com/asus_rog/status/1650862237505163264?s=61&t=J…
articles.title: Asus is hosting a launch event for its ROG Ally PC handheld in May
